message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product, which we believe holds immense value. For this exceptional item, I propose a price of $120. I understand that its worth may be subjective, but considering its quality and features, I believe this is a fair offer.
Alice, I appreciate the offer but $120 is a bit outside my budget. Considering the value I place on this product, I'm willing to pay $80 for it. Let me know if that works for you.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position and respect your valuation of the product. In light of your offer, I would like to counter with a price of $95. This is higher than your proposal but still reflects the value we place on the product. I hope this meets within your acceptable range.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise. While $95 is closer, it's still a bit higher than my ideal price.  I'm firm on $85.  This is a fair price that reflects the value I see in the product, and I hope you'll agree.

Thank you for your continued interest, Bob. I've considered your latest offer carefully, and I'm pleased to counter with a price of $88. This is the highest price I can offer while still maintaining the profitability of the sale. I hope this aligns more closely with what you're comfortable with.
Alice, I appreciate your effort to meet me halfway.  I'm still a little hesitant to go above $85.  Is there any room for us to come to an agreement there?  If not, I'll have to explore other options.
